channeldata.summary: The sqldf() function is typically passed a single argument which  is an SQL select statement where the table names are ordinary R data  frame names.  sqldf() transparently sets up a database, imports the  data frames into that database, performs the SQL select or other statement and returns the result using a heuristic to determine which  class to assign to each column of the returned data frame.  The sqldf()  or read.csv.sql() functions can also be used to read filtered files  into R even if the original files are larger than R itself can handle. 'RSQLite', 'RH2', 'RMySQL' and 'RPostgreSQL' backends are supported.
